page.title: 18TOWN CENTRE CHANGES
page.content:
There are many changes taking place to the landscape around Telford Town Centre. Telford railway station is being built near to the Hollinsood Interchange. It will be quite big. Fast trains will run to London. There will be a walk-way to the Town-Centre for passengers.
The Inland Revenue has square shaped offices here. Another office building is Darby House which is made from mirror glass. It is used by the Brown Bovery Corporation. We can see it from our School, Queenswood County Primary.
A new hotel is being built on Rampart Way called the Moat House Hotel. It is close to the new railway station. It will be useful for tourists. It is not shown on maps yet and it only seems to have two floors at the moment.
